marketNews.title: MSCI Indonesia Index Review August 2025
marketNews.content: MSCI announced the review of its Global Standard, Small Cap, and Micro Cap indices, effective 27 August 2025. Details: MSCI Indonesia Global Standard – Added: DSSA, CUAN; Removed: ADRO. MSCI Indonesia Small Cap – Added: AADI, ADRO, KPIG, PTRO, RATU, TAPG; Removed: MBMA, PNLF. MSCI Indonesia Micro Cap – No additions or deletions. The next review will be announced on 5 November 2025, effective 25 November 2025. Key Takeaway: Securities added to the index will receive inflows, potentially acting as positive catalysts for their share price movements. Following this news, the majority of stocks added to the MSCI index closed higher on Friday (8/8): DSSA (+20%), CUAN (+7.2%), AADI (+2.8%), PTRO (+9%), RATU (+5.4%), TAPG (+2.4%) while KPIG fell (-1.9%). Conversely, stocks that were downgraded or removed from the MSCI index weakened on the same day, such as ADRO (-4.3%), MBMA (-7.3%), and PNLF (-1.6%).

marketNews.title: Top Gainers
marketNews.content: Top Gainers: DSSA (+20.00%), TKIM (+11.55%), EMTK (+9.32%), PTRO (+9.01%).

marketNews.title: Other Hot Topics
marketNews.content: Gaikindo reported wholesale car sales in July 2025 reached 60,552 units (down 18% YoY, up 5% MoM). This results in 7M25 wholesale sales of 435,293 units (down 10% YoY), representing 48-58% of the 2025 target of 750,000-900,000 units (vs 7M24: 56% realization 2024). AISI reported domestic motorcycle sales in July 2025 reached 587,048 units (down 2% YoY, up 15.3% MoM). 7M25 motorcycle sales total about 3.7 million units (down 2.1% YoY), equal to 55-58% of the 2025 target of 6.4-6.7 million units (vs 7M24: 60% realization 2024). Survey from the Indonesian Internet Service Providers Association showed Shopee was the most accessed e-commerce platform in 2025 with a access share of 53.22%, up from 41.65% the previous year. TikTok Shop had 27.37% (vs 2024: 12.2%), Tokopedia 9.57% (vs 2024: 9.4%). Lazada’s share fell to 9.09% in 2025 (vs 2024: 17.54%), followed by Blibli (BELI) which fell to 0.29% (vs 2024: 0.36%). Bloomberg reported that Indonesia’s 10-year government bond yield fell by 3 basis points to 6.42% on Friday (8/8), the lowest since September 2023. The decline occurred amid rising expectations of a Fed rate cut in September 2025 and softer US dollar, as well as expectations of further BI rate cuts. Bloomberg noted foreign investors have bought $3.5 billion of Indonesian government bonds since the start of 2025, exceeding 2024 inflows. Bank Indonesia reported the Indonesian consumer confidence index rose to 118.1 in July 2025 (vs June 2025: 117.8, July 2024: 123.4). The increase was driven by rises in almost all sub-indices except current income index, which fell 2.4 points to 117.8, and business activity expectations index, which weakened 1.8 points to 127.5. The chairman of the Regional Real Estate Indonesia (REI) DKI Jakarta, Arvin F. Iskandar, said on Thursday (7/8) that the organization targets 50 developer members to go public via IPO. The plan aims to strengthen developers’ capital to support housing supply and the government’s 3-million-house program. REI DKI Jakarta will promote a Jakarta Property Index as a regional property sector performance indicator for domestic and foreign investors. REI also intends to facilitate about 10-20 developers per year to conduct IPOs or issue other property investment instruments. Currently only 1% of the 500 REI DPP members are listed.

marketNews.content: "But basically Myanmar is one of the influential tin suppliers in the world. The geopolitical condition in Myanmar creates supply issues in the global tin industry." – thowilz

tickerNews.title: PPRI Share Acquisition by GULA and DATA Executives
tickerNews.content: $PPRI: Chief Commissioner Aman Agrindo (GULA), Irsyad Hanif, purchased 140 million shares of Paperocks Indonesia at an average price of 50 rupiah per share from PPRI's President Director Catur Jatiwaluyo on 7 August 2025. After the transaction, Irsyad Hanif's ownership in PPRI increased from 2.6% to 15.6%, while Catur Jatiwaluyo's ownership decreased from 13% to zero. In a separate transaction, founder Remala Abadi (DATA), Budi Aditya Erna Mulyanto, bought 97.2 million PPRI shares at an average price of 159 rupiah per share on 5 August 2025. After this, Budi's ownership rose from 4.65% to 13.69%. Both Irsyad and Budi stated the transactions are for long-term investment. PPRI's Company Secretary Dillon Sutandar said the divestment by Catur is intended for retirement preparation.

tickerNews.title: KIJA Marketing Sales Performance
tickerNews.content: $KIJA: Jababeka Industrial Estate recorded marketing sales of 741 billion rupiah in 2Q25 (down 31% YoY, down 37% QoQ). This result brings 1H25 marketing sales to 1.9 trillion rupiah (+13% YoY), about 55% of the 2025 target of 3.5 trillion rupiah. The joint venture in Kendal Industrial Estate contributed 73% of total 1H25 marketing sales.

tickerNews.title: AMMN Share Sale by Director
tickerNews.content: $AMMN: Director of Amman Mineral International, David Alexander Gibbs, sold approximately 28 million AMMN shares at an average price of 7,492 rupiah per share on 4 August 2025. The total transaction value was about 209.7 billion rupiah. After the transaction, David's direct ownership in AMMN fell from 0.055% to 0.016%.

tickerNews.title: NICL Share Purchase by PAM Mineral Controller
tickerNews.content: $NICL: PAM Mineral controller Christopher Sumasto Tjia bought approximately 3 million NICL shares at an average price of 1,035 rupiah per share on 7 August 2025. The total transaction value was about 3.1 billion rupiah. After the transaction, Christopher's direct ownership in NICL increased from 0.454% to 0.482%.

tickerNews.title: MSIN Plans Private Placement
tickerNews.content: $MSIN: MNC Digital Entertainment plans to conduct a private placement of approximately 6.1 billion new shares, resulting in dilution of up to 9.09%. The proceeds will be used to strengthen the company's capital structure. The issue price and prospective investors have not been disclosed. The plan will be discussed at the extraordinary general meeting on 15 September 2025.
